titleStmt.title: Pecuniæ obediunt omnia Money masters all things, or, Satyrical poems, shewing the power and influence of money over all men, of what profession or trade soever they be : to which are added, A Lenten litany, by Mr. C____d, A satyr on Mr. Dryden, and several other modern translators : also A satyr on women in general : together with Mr. Oldham's Character of a certain ugly old p----
titleStmt.author: Menton, L.
C---d, Mr. Lenten litany.
Oldham, John, 1653-1683. Character of a certain ugly old p-----.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed, and sold by the booksellers of London and Westminster,

notesStmt.note: Attributed to L. Menton. Cf. Stonehill, C.A. Anonyma and pseudonyma. London, 1926-27. v. 3, col. 2078.
Second edition. The first edition, 1696, contained the title poem only.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
